head.title: I Just Ate My A B C's, Tell Me What You Think of Me

hedline.hl1: I Just Ate My A B C's, Tell Me What You Think of Me

abstract.p: Once Upon a Tart offers cookies in shape of letters, pencil, eraser, apple and sheet of paper in tin lunchbox; photo (S)

block.p: Homework was never this delicious. Colorfully iced sugar cookies in the shape of the letters A, B and C, a pencil, an eraser, an apple and a sheet of lined paper (but, alas, no Pokemon cards) are tucked into a small tin lunchbox from Once Upon a Tart, 135 Sullivan Street (Prince Street).
Once the cookies are polished off, the box easily holds a sandwich and a carton of juice. It's $21.

Homework was never this delicious. Colorfully iced sugar cookies in the shape of the letters A, B and C, a pencil, an eraser, an apple and a sheet of lined paper (but, alas, no Pokemon cards) are tucked into a small tin lunchbox from Once Upon a Tart, 135 Sullivan Street (Prince Street).
Once the cookies are polished off, the box easily holds a sandwich and a carton of juice. It's $21.

And going back to school was never this much fun: the bakery will hold baking classes for children 6 though 13 on Mondays from Sept. 18 through Oct. 30 from 3:45 to 5:15 p.m. The cost, $75, benefits the Sharing Foundation, which aids Cambodian orphanages. Reservations: (212) 387-8869.
